{{refimprove|date=February 2013}} {{Historical populations |type = |footnote = Source:{{cite web|title=Censos de Población y Vivienda|url=http://www.one.gob.do/Estadisticas/263/poblacion-y-vivienda|website=Oficina Nacional de Estadística|accessdate=26 June 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170629213312/http://one.gob.do/Estadisticas/263/poblacion-y-vivienda|archive-date=29 June 2017|url-status=dead}} |1920 | 894665 |1935 | 1479417 |1950 | 2135872 |1960 | 3047070 |1970 | 4009458 |1981 | 5545741 |1993 | 7293390 |2002 | 8562541 |2010 | 9445281 |2017 | 10169172 }} This article is about the [[demographics|demographic]] features of the [[population]] of the [[Dominican Republic]], including [[population density]], [[Ethnic group|ethnicity]], education level, health of the populace, economic status, religious affiliations and other aspects of the population. ==Population== [[File:Dominican Rep demography.png|thumb|450px|The Dominican Republic's population (1961–2003).]] According to {{UN_Population|source}} the total population was {{UN_Population|Dominican Republic}} in {{UN_Population|Year}}, compared to 2,380,000 in 1950. The proportion of the population aged below 15 in 2010 was 31.2%, 62.8% were aged between 15 and 65 years of age, while 6% were aged 65 years or older.[http://esa.un.org/unpd/wpp/index.htm Population Division of the Department of Economic and Social Affairs of the United Nations Secretariat, World Population Prospects: The 2012 Revision] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110506065230/http://esa.un.org/unpd/wpp/index.htm |date=May 6, 2011 }} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: right;" |- ! ! width="70pt"|Total population
(x 1000) ! width="70pt"|Proportion
aged 0–14

aged 15–64
(%) ! width="70pt"|Proportion
aged 65+

style="text-align:right;"| 2,4 (1,9) | style="text-align:right;"| 20,3 | style="text-align:right;"| 2,6 (2,1) |- |} == Other demographic statistics == Demographic statistics according to the World Population Review in 2019.{{cite|url=http://worldpopulationreview.com/countries/dominican-republic-population/|title=Dominican Republic Population 2019|website=World Population Review}} *One birth every 2 minutes *One death every 8 minutes *One net migrant every 18 minutes *Net gain of one person every 5 minutes Demographic statistics according to the [[CIA World Factbook]], unless otherwise indicated.{{cite|url=https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/the-world-factbook/geos/dr.html|title=World Factbook CENTRAL AMERICA : DOMINICAN REPUBLIC|work=[[The World Factbook]]|date=July 12, 2018}} {{PD-notice}} ;Population: :10,298,756 (July 2018 est.) ;Age structure: [[File:Dominican Republicpop.svg|thumb|350px|Population pyramid of Dominican Republic in 2017]] :''0-14 years:'' 27.56% (male 1,442,926 /female 1,395,809) :''15-24 years:'' 18.52% (male 969,467 /female 937,765) :''25-54 years:'' 40.28% (male 2,112,813 /female 2,035,902) :''55-64 years:'' 7.71% (male 397,821 /female 396,172) :''65 years and over:'' 5.92% (male 286,300 /female 323,781) (2018 est.) ;Ethnic groups: :mixed 70.4% (mestizo/indio 58%, mulatto 12.4%), black 15.8%, white 13.5%, other 0.3% (2014 est.) :note: respondents self-identified their race; the term "indio" in the Dominican Republic is not associated with people of indigenous ancestry but people of mixed ancestry or skin color between light and dark ;Median age: :total: 27.3 years. Country comparison to the world: 145th :male: 27.1 years :female: 27.4 years (2018 est.) ;Birth rate: :18.9 births/1,000 population (2018 est.) Country comparison to the world: 84th ;Death rate: :6.4 deaths/1,000 population (2018 est.) Country comparison to the world: 145th ;[[Total fertility rate]]: :2.28 children born/woman (2018 est.) Country comparison to the world: 88th ;Net migration rate: :-2.6 migrant(s)/1,000 population (2018 est.) Country comparison to the world: 170th ;Population growth rate: :0.99% (2018 est.) Country comparison to the world: 109th ;Mother's mean age at first birth: :21.3 years (2013 est.) :note: median age at first birth among women 25-29 ;Contraceptive prevalence rate: :69.5% (2014) ;[[Dependency ratio]]s: :''total dependency ratio:'' 57.8 (2015 est.) Country comparison to the world: 151st :''youth dependency ratio:'' 47.3 (2015 est.) :''elderly dependency ratio:'' 10.5 (2015 est.) :''potential support ratio:'' 9.5 (2015 est.) ;Life expectancy at birth: :total population: 71.3 years. Country comparison to the world: 151st :male: 69.7 years :female: 73.1 years (2018 est.) ;Religions: *[[Roman Catholic]] 95% *Other 5% ;Urbanization: :urban population: 81.1% of total population (2018) :rate of urbanization: 2.06% annual rate of change (2015-20 est.) ;Languages: *[[Spanish language|Spanish]] (official)'' ;Literacy: definition: age 15 and over can read and write (2016 est.) :total population: 93.8% :male: 93.8% :female: 93.8% (2016 est.) ;School life expectancy (primary to tertiary education): :total: 14 years :male: 13 years :female: 14 years (2016) Unemployment, youth ages 15-24: :total: 13.4%. Country comparison to the world: 97th :male: 8.5% :female: 21.7% (2016 est.) ==See also== *[[Health in the Dominican Republic]] *[[Youth in the Dominican Republic]] :'''Census information:''' *[[1920 Santo Domingo Census]] *[[1950 Dominican Republic Census]] *[[1960 Dominican Republic Census]] *[[1970 Dominican Republic Census]] *[[2010 Dominican Republic Census]] == References == {{Reflist}} {{Dominican Republic topics}} {{North America in topic|Demographics of}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Demographics Of The Dominican Republic}} [[Category:Demographics by country|Dominican Republic]] [[Category:Demographics of the Dominican Republic]]
